description.narrative: The HCFC Phase-out Management Plan for the Plurinational State of Bolivia was approved in July 2011 at the 64th Meeting of Executive Committee of the Multilateral Fund for the implementation of the Montreal Protocol. The project was approved in accordance with the Agreement between the Government and the Executive Committee for the period 2011 to 2020 to meet the 35 per cent reduction in HCFC consumption, in line with decision 60/44. At the time of the HPMP approval the first tranche was approved with a total cost of US $ 106 ,785 including support cost for GIZ. . During the 72nd ExCom Meeting in May 2014 the amended Agreement, including more ODP tonnes to be phased out, and the second tranche with a total cost of US $ 106,785 including support cost for GIZ were approved. However, the Implementing Agency and the Government of Bolivia agreed to transfer the project implementation and the funds approved for the second tranche to UNIDO. UNIDO, as selected lead Agency, is requesting the transfer of the second tranche approved with the respective support costs and the transfer of the funds approved for the HCFC consumption verification. This document is presenting the implementation plan for the second tranche of the #HCFC Phase out Management Plan for Annex C Group I Substances# (HPMP) for the Plurinational State
